title: The Age of Magic Begins
description: When planet Prysmos' three suns shift, they cancel out the power of all electronic and battery-powered devices, forcing the inhabitants to restart their society as archaic. A mysterious old wizard named Merklyn approaches Darkstorm, a knight who has been trying to seize control of the land of New Valaric, and Leoric, the prince and lead knight defending it, offering them and their allies the chance to receive vast magical powers if they can survive the climb up Iron Mountain and its perils to his shrine. After those who have remained and survived the tests out of the large group succeed, Merklynn dubs Leoirc and his six followers and Darkstorm and six whom he already had or has just forced into his service the Visionaries, and endows all the ability to transform into an animal totem based on their characteristics and skills demonstrated. Eight of them are also granted power to their staffs which will offer them additional abilities, and the remaining six are assured that they will have other gifts which remain to be seen.

title: The Dark Hand of Treachery
description: Arzon is captured and has his power staff stolen by the Darkling Lords. While scrounging for metal so the rest of New Valaric's knights can be bound later, Mortredd and Reekon discover their gift is to repower Prismos' vehicles. Between this and their other abilities, the Darkling Lords seize Witterquick and Cryotek and take their staffs. Galadria is given a chance to escape and warns the others, but the advice of what to do from the Owl of Wisdom of Leoric's staff is enigmatic. The Darkling Lords attack Leoric's castle and capture the other knights, steal their staffs, and strip Feryl of his wolf totem. And Darkstorm blackmails the New Valaricans into serving him after aging one who defies him.

title: Quest for the Dragon's Eye
description: Arzon and Leoric free the other Spectral Knights while the Darkling Lords are fighting, restore Feryl's totem, and subdue Darkstorm's soldiers. When Darkstorm discovers the staffs have been drained of power, the Darkling Lords try to escape the Spectral Knights, and the chase confirms that Ectar and Feryl share Reekon's and Mortredd's power. Just before starting forced labor in a factory, the Darkling Lords are given a magical key by Merklynn. While most of the Spectral Knights are on their way to approach Merklynn for assistance for the barren land, the Darkling Lords escape and attempt to kill them on Iron Mountain. Ectar warns them, but neither side is allowed by Merklynn to confront the other once they reach him. He lets them repower their staffs but demands that in return they retrieve the Dragon's Eye for him. The Spectral Knights agree but the Darkling Lords go only after an attack on him fails, and at an abandoned building, both are attacked by a mechanical dragon controlled by the wizard wielding the Eye, Falkama.

title: Feryl Steps Out
description: Feryl is almost captured when the Capture Chariot crashes while he is trying to help Leoric stop a pirate raid. Feeling overshadowed by the other Spectral Knights, he chooses to leave their ranks. When one of his spies hears this, Darkstorm goes with Mortredd to seek his services. Feryl refuses and fights them off before they can capture him to force him onto their side, but Darkstorm has Cravex have the Spider of Fear of his staff bite Leoric to make him suffer a nightmare he takes as an omen that the Darkling Lords have seized Feryl. Leoric runs into a trap and is captured, has his lion totem removed and staff stolen, and is placed in a device which will stretch him until his muscles break. Feryl follows them, but has no time to get the other Spectral Knights to help him fight.

title: Lion Hunt
description: Rather than do another favor for Merklyn in exchange for a power-staff recharge, Darkstorm seeks out the ancient witch Heskedor for a curse to place on Leoric. He is given a potion that will prevent Leoric from turning from a lion back into a man - permanently, if it isn't reversed by third sunset on the same day. The Darkling Lords run one of their vehicles disguised as an animal through a village whose inhabitants are superstitious against all magic and, when Leoric is called to help, spray him. It also turns him from blue to red and Darkstorm convinces the people that this is what Leoric was killed by so must be destroyed. Fletchen, a young woman from the village, gives the Spectral Knights word, but they don't know the truth about what they're looking to take down either...

title: The Overthrow of Merklynn
description: Reluctant as always to see Merklynn to recharge his power staff and be ordered to do something in return, Mortredd asks Falkama how to defeat him. Reekon succeeds in getting the magic book the Omnitopogram so Darkstorm can strip him of his power and claim his crystal ball after getting him away from his shrine which protects him. The Darkling Lords allow the Spectral Knights to capture them and, when Merklynn appears to free them from the factory again, Darkstorm uses a plant to subdue him, steals the ball so he can create magic of his own, and subdues Falkama. After banishing the wizards to a prison they cannot escape from, he frees himself, immobilizes the Spectral Knights so the other Darkling Lords can follow, and curses Virulina, Reekon, and Lexor for pressing for more pay. But his plans for world domination with th others are interrupted when he dares to cast the mysterious, never-before-done Sacred Secret Spell, which causes a series of natural disasters destined to destroy Prismos.

title: The Power of the Wise
description: Reekon spies on the Spectral Knights in lizard form so hears which of the Darkling Lords' power staffs they consider the worst challenges. After the Spectral Knights unsuccessfully request Merklynn to give them something to use against Darkstorm's decay and the Bearer of Knowledge tells Arzon of the Eternal Spring which would do just this, Reekon goes back to the Darkling Lords and tells them that this is their weapon that most troubles Leoric. As the Spectral Knights travel to the spring, the Darkling Lords attack and force the others away from Leoric, whom Darkstorm ages into an old man. Then they advance toward the water, intending to stop him from being rejuvenated, and, after Cindarr's attempt to help an infant scorpion-monster brings the wrath of its mother, Cravex manipulates it into panicking and attacking the Spectral Knights when they arrive, slowing their progress even more.

title: The Price of Freedom
description: Reekon and Mortredd are seen in the functioning Dagger Assault by a man of Khemir, a ruined city that relied on robot slaves and whose people have never worked for themselves and are not eager to start. Arzon and Feryl spy their going over but Reekon tricks the Khemirites into attacking them, and on their way to tell the other Spectral Knights the Capture Chariot is damaged and Arzon injured. The Darkling Lords promise to supply the Khemirites with slaves in exchange for their allegiance, and Darkstorm has a group disguised as poor wanderers enter the Spectral Knights' castle to let them in. They steal Leoric's and Witterquick's power-staffs for the Darkling Lords, who best the Spectral Knights, remove their totems, and force them into slavery as an alternative to torturing the New Valaricans. When Feryl and Arzon finally make it back, Feryl is captured but Arzon escapes - but Darkstorm orders that he must surrender, or the other Spectral Knights will be forced to work the dangerous vanadium mines.

title: Horn of Unicorn, Claw of Dragon
description: Cryotek abruptly falls sick with a strange disease Fletchen can't heal. When they try to leave to seek Merklynn's help, Ectar and Feryl's vehicles don't respond to them then Feryl sickens, Galadria catches it from Cryotek, and Leoric's power staff won't work. Fletchen tells Leoric that those without magical power are immune, so he warns Witterquick and Arzon away and has them go to Merklynn. Lexor is already there with Cindarr since the Darkling Lords are also suffering, and the two Spectral Knights barge in when he threatens Merklynn, whom he blames, if he doesn't remove it. Merklynn reveals that the illness will eventually kill all who use magic, and finding a dragon's claw and unicorn's horn for the antidote was the last task the Darkling Lords refused to go on for him. Lexor and Cindarr go after the unicorn since it's the gentler creature, but have a difficult time against the wood nymphs guarding their island. Arzon and Witterquick seek a dragon called Gregsgamar, and find themselves fighting for their lives against him as well as time during which the sickness worsens for the others and threatens to strike them...

title: The Trail of Three Wizards
description: Merklynn persuades the Spectral Knights to capture three of the wizards who escaped the Wizards' Jail after Darkstorm's betrayal, Falkama, Wizasquizar, and the possibly-good Bogavus, before one of them stumbles upon the Lost Shrine and gains extreme power. They scour the Anarchy Zone as recommended, and Ectar uses his police-officer skills to interrogate a former criminal dwarf into telling him how to find the trio. The Spectral Knights split up and succeed, but Reekon sees them on their return journey so has the Darkling Lords sabotage their vehicles and attack them when they prepare to ride back. They release Wizasquizar since he is under a spell to always lie, guessing the Darkling Lords will capture though not find much use for him. But when he acts uncharacteristically self-defacing for a wizard, Lexor learns who they're dealing with and they learn through his answers where the Lost Shrine is, and decide to take him there so they all can be empowered. When the Spectral Knights go after them, they're swallowed whole by a liquid monster while near the shrine Wizasquizar triggers the old zoo security robots so the Darkling Lords, who naturally try to escape in animal form, will be captured.

title: Honor Among Thieves
description: Though the Spectral Knights have insisted they don't want pay for returning the wizards, Merklynn gives them a crystal which will alert them to any foe's approach. But, after leading an attack which fails because of it, Darkstorm discovers that it can't detect anyone wearing the Cloak of Concealment. After getting it from a carnivorous plant in exchange for a shipment of meat, the Darkling Lords have Reekon don the jacket and enter on a tour of the Spectral Knights' council chamber where it is kept, and he is able to steal it. Ectar, who as a detective caught Reekon once, prepares with Arzon's help to act as a robber to reclaim it while Reekon will be the one waiting to thwart him.

title: Dawn of the Sun Imps
description: While Cravex and Mortredd are chasing Feryl and Arzon, the four stumble upon a tomb with the warning of a curse. Everyone but Cravex wants to avoid it, so the Spectral Knights and Darkling Lords ask Merklynn about it. He explains that it is a prison forged by him and his allies for the Sun Imps, dislodged from underground by earthquakes, and requests the Visionaries to rebury it. But Lexor thinks something more powerful and less harmful to them must be hidden there so manipulates Cindarr into using the Beast of Destruction to open it. The six imps escape, wrecking havoc on New Valaric and tormenting all the Visionaries as well as Merklynn.

title: Sorcery Squared
description: After an accident dancing with Galadria and misunderstanding some well-meaning remarks from her, Ectar, and Witterquick at a feast, Cryotek jumps at the chance to help Arzon and Feryl remove some pieces of construction from an eagle's nest. The Darkling Lords, responsible for discarding the damaged slabs, attack when they arrive before the three can leave, and capture Cryotek and start to remove his polar-bear totem. He manages to drag Cravex into the Magical Dungeon with him partway through, and the Darkling Lords try to undo the process. When Cryotek escapes, he steals Cindarr's staff - and, as Galadria and Witterquick discover when he starts acting boisterous then aggressive and steals Witterquick's staff of light-speed, has actually kept the phylot totem as well as his own. It is altering his personality enough so he wants to expand his home city of Northalia. Neither the Spectral Knights nor the Darkling Lords want him to keep Cravex's totem, so they unite to subdue him, but the Darkling Lords' worse tempers and selfish motives may not result in him being returned to normal while still physically well. And Cryotek proves a major danger to both with the more sinister influence controlling him.
